_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary - North Central Cooperative - Woden Facility


Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
 This facility complies with regulated anhydrous ammonia storage requirements and it is our policy to 
 adhere to all federal, state and local laws. If an emergency were to occur it is our policy to notify the
 Woden Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

Description of Facility:
 This facility is a retail farm supplier. We sell anhydrous ammonia to farmers for the purpose of crop 
 production. On site we have a 30,000 gallon storage tank and an 18000 gallon storage tank. These
 tanks are filled to a maximum of 85% capacity to allow for product expansion.

Worst Case Release Scenario:
 Our worst case scenario is a gas release from one of the storage tanks. According to EPA's RMP Comp
 the distance to endpoint is 3.20 miles. There are residences, a school and recreation areas within the
 distance to endpoint, with a total of 322 people being affected.


Alternative Release Scenario:
Our alternative release statement is a transfer hose failure. According to EPA's RMP Comp, the distance to endpoint is 0.20 miles with residences and a school within this distance, with a total of one person being affected. 

This facility has excess flow valves and emergency shutoffs installed to minimize the chances of a release occurring. All personnel are trained annually in the safe operation of the equipment and the facility. We have also installed concrete barriers in traffic pattern areas in an effort to eliminate damage from a vehicualr accident.


General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:
 This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state and local codes
 and regulations. This facility is annually inspected by in-house personnel and by the Iowa Department
 of Agriculture.

Five-Year Accident History:
 We have never had

an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused death, injuries, property or
 environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

The Emergency Response Program:
 In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammoina facility, it is our policy to notify the Woden
 Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with
 the fire department. Members of the fire department have inspected our ahydrous ammonia facility.

Planned Changes to Improve Saftey:
 None
